metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3644 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Stunnel 5.00 through 5.13, when using the redirect option, does not redirect client connections to the expected server after the initial connection, which allows remote attackers to bypass authentication.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3644` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

stunnel4 - 3:5.18-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> possibly does not affect 4.x based on stunnel advisory

criterions.comment: stunnel4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3:5.18-1').
